project.name: Pundit
project.description: Augment web pages with semantically structured annotations.

pundit.name: pundit
pundit.description:
The Pundit system!
Aims at providing all of the needed components to create stand-off markup
on any web page.

Drives the orchestra of pundit annotators

pundit.KorboBasketSelector.name: pundit.KorboBasketSelector
pundit.KorboBasketSelector.description: Selects items from a Korbo basket

pundit.selectors.SelectorBase.name: pundit.selectors.SelectorBase
pundit.selectors.SelectorBase.description:
Base class for Pundit Selectors. 
TODO TODO TODO TODO

pundit.selectors.VocabSelector.name: pundit.selectors.VocabSelector
pundit.selectors.VocabSelector.description:
Is responsible for the loading and managing of vocabularies that 
are used in the annotations. Vocabularies are special JSON files loaded at run time 
using JSONP to avoid same origin policy. Togheter with the vocabularies 
also related relation are loaded. Vocabularies are configurable in 
NamespaceHelper file setting the vocabs object.

pundit.authenticatedRequests.name: pundit.authenticatedRequests
pundit.authenticatedRequests.description:
Provides facilities to interact with the pundit server, through
authenticated API Calls. The authentication is granted by an OpenID workflow,
initialized here and carried on by the server. When logged in, this component
notifies the user and executes any previously blocked request, which needed
authentication to work.

params.name: options
params.description: See object properties

pundit.baseComponent.name: pundit.baseComponent
pundit.baseComponent.description:
Provides common facilities used by other pundit
components, such as callback creation, initialization, logging, etc.

Every component extending this class will be able to use these methods,
and the options passed to the constructor.

If the component has an .opts field, it will be used as defaults for the
component, overwritable when calling new

params.name: options
params.description: See object properties

pundit.BasePanel.name: pundit.BasePanel
pundit.BasePanel.description:
Provides the base GUI a of floating panel. Different parameters 
can be specified to enable draggability and preview. Basic methods can be inherited 
to extend it features

params.name: options
params.description: See object properties

pundit.DataTxt.name: pundit.DataTxt
pundit.DataTxt.description:
Provides facilities to query the DataTxt service 
Annotation services and the DBpedia SPARQL endpoint.

pundit.CommentTag.name: pundit.CommentTag
pundit.CommentTag.description:
Provides a GUI (floating Panel) and set of facilities 
for the creation of comments and tags. Tags can be retrieved both using 
DBpedia Spotlight (annotating the text comment). Tags can be removed and navigated
Created comments and tags are then saved to pundit annotation server

pundit.CommentTagPanel.name: pundit.CommentTagPanel
pundit.CommentTagPanel.description:
Provides a GUI (floating Panel) for adding textual comment and tags.
Tags can be searched in different lookup services like Freebase, Dbpedia and Wordnet.
They can also be automatically extacted from added text using DBpedia Spotlight service
Created comments and tags are then saved to pundit annotation server.
Comment Tag Panel extend Recognizer Panel to reuse its capability to search for tags

params.name: options
params.description: See object properties

pundit.Configuration.name: pundit.Configuration
pundit.Configuration.description:
This component deals with the various layers of Pundit configuration.
These layers are:
1. component defaults
2. global Configuration defaults
3. user supplied configuration file
4. parameters passed to the component constructor
When initialized, the Configuration module will merge the levels 2 and 3, creating the .config field in the global pundit live object (_PUNDIT).
When a component is initialized its final .opts field will be a merge of all of those levels: 4 being the higher priority.

pundit.contextualMenu.name: pundit.contextualMenu
pundit.contextualMenu.description:
Provides methods and callbacks to open a contextual menu with customizable options and actions.
The actions are organized by "types", various components can activate the contextual menu for a certain type, and all of the actions subscribed with that type will be shown.
Each action can have its own function which decides wether to show it or not, and its own onClick callback to be executed.
When the contextual menu is shown, an unique identifier or a complex data structure must be passed in, allowing each action to run their showIf() function, and eventually the onclick().

pundit.DbpediaSpotlight.name: pundit.DbpediaSpotlight
pundit.DbpediaSpotlight.description:
Provides facilities to query the DBpedia Spotlight 
Annotation services and the DBpedia SPARQL endpoint.

pundit.ImageAnnotationPanel.name: pundit.ImageAnnotationPanel
pundit.ImageAnnotationPanel.description:
Provides a GUI (floating Panel) for showing items grouped according 
from their provenance ('My Item', 'Page Items', Vocabularies)

pundit.Init.name: pundit.Init
pundit.Init.description:
Init class: initializes all of the pundit components. The init object
is saved in the global pundit live namespace under the name of 'init', for future
use. Since the global live namespace name defaults to "punditLive", the init
object is accessible by default with punditLive.init

pundit.ItemContainerManager.name: pundit.ItemContainerManager
pundit.ItemContainerManager.description:
Is responsible of the instantiation of different item containers
(PageItems, MyItems) and provide facilities for their management. In particular 
it allows to execute operation on all the item containers (ex. item refresh, search, ...)

pundit.myPundit.name: pundit.myPundit
pundit.myPundit.description:
Handles the authentication workflow and stores informations about the logged in user, like username, notebooks and other useful stuff.
Checks if the user is logged in at startup, and request him to log in if needed.

pundit.NotebookManager.name: pundit.NotebookManager
pundit.NotebookManager.description:
Provides a GUI (floating Panel) for showing items grouped according 
from their provenance ('My Item', 'Page Items', Vocabularies)

pundit.PageHandler.name: pundit.PageHandler
pundit.PageHandler.description:
Provides a GUI (floating Panel) and set of facilities 
for the creation of comments and tags. Tags can be retrieved both using 
DBpedia Spotlight (annotating the text comment). Tags can be removed and navigated
Created comments and tags are then saved to pundit annotation server

pundit.Previewer.name: pundit.Previewer
pundit.Previewer.description:
Offers facilities to create a nice and common HTML preview of a given pundit item, extracting its properties from its bucket.
Shows, hides and sets loading on demand.

pundit.RecognizerPanel.name: pundit.RecognizerPanel
pundit.RecognizerPanel.description:
Provides a GUI (floating Panel) for recognizing a selected text fragment searching in different sources ('My Item', 'Page Items', Vocabularies) and from lookup services Freebase, Dbpedia and Wordnet. It extend the Resource Panel search capability with the possibity to selected searched tags and use to compose a triple
:fragment rdfs:seeAlso tag1, tag2, ...

pundit.ResourcesPanel.name: pundit.ResourcesPanel
pundit.ResourcesPanel.description:
Provides a GUI (floating Panel) for showing items grouped according 
from their provenance ('My Item', 'Page Items', Vocabularies)

pundit.TripleComposer.name: pundit.TripleComposer
pundit.TripleComposer.description:
Offers a cute drag 'n drop GUI to create triples. Interacts
with other components to show possible drop targets for a given dragged
pundit item and, the other way around, highlights pundit items 
which are accepted by a clicked drop target. It will use item rdf types and
predicates ranges/domains of already present items in the subject, predicate
and object targets, to be as accurate as possible with the suggestions.

pundit.XpointersHelper.name: pundit.XpointersHelper
pundit.XpointersHelper.description:
Provides a set of utilities to work with xpointers
and xpaths. Massively used to consolidate and extract content
from the DOM.

classitems.description: Enables debug messages for the component
classitems.name: debug

classitems.description: Name of the component, shown in debug messages
classitems.name: libName
createCallback
classitems.description:
Creates one or more callbacks for the component. For each 'name' passed as parameter two methods will be created:
onName(f) (first letter is automatically capitalized): used by other components to subscribe a function to be called when the event hits. Optional parameters.
fireOnName(data) (first letter is automatically capitalized): fires the event calling all of the subscribed callbacks passing data as parameter. This function must be called by the component when needed.

params.name: names
params.description: Names of the callbacks to be created.

classitems.name: log
classitems.description:
Logs a debug message in the browser console or (if not
present) in a debug div appended to the document.

params.name: options

classitems.name: punditConfig.annotationServerBaseURL
classitems.description:
Absolute base URL of the Pundit server side APIs, ending
with /

classitems.name: punditConfig.debugAllModules
classitems.description: Activates/deactivates debug mode for every component

classitems.name: punditConfig.showSettings
classitems.description: Activates/deactivates the settings panel

classitems.name: punditConfig.enableSemanticExpansion
classitems.description: Enables/disables the link to LodLive for exploring Linked Data around items

classitems.name: punditConfig.enableEntitiesExtraction
classitems.description: Enables/disables the automatic entitities extraction from text in the page

classitems.name: punditConfig.vocabularies
classitems.description:
Specifies vocaularies that will be available to Pundit users. 
Vocabularies have a unique name and a description. They can be of different
types: taxonomy (defines a hierarchy of terms), relations (defines a list 
of relations with domain and ranges). Each vocabulary definition is a JSONP
file available on the Web and is loaded by resolving an absolute URL.

classitems.name: punditConfig.useBasicRelations
classitems.description: Loads Pundit's basic relations

classitems.name: punditConfig.modules
classitems.description: Configuration for various Pundit optional modules

classitems.name: punditConfig.modules.annotators
classitems.description:
Configuration for Pundit annotators: components who
deal (read, write, visualize etc) with various type of items used
into annotations, for example text fragments, image fragments etc.

classitems.name: punditConfig.modules.selectors
classitems.description:
Configuration for Pundit selectors: components who
retrieve items from remote sources like Freebase, Wordnet, Europeana
etc. Each children should be named after a Selector found in src/selectors
omitting the ending part "Selector". Each object must contain the
properties name (string), label (string) and active (boolean). Moreover
it can contain selector-specific configuration options, like europeanaKey
or limit or keyInputTimerLength. See each selector docs for more info.

classitems.name: isModuleActive
classitems.description: Returns true if the given module name is active

params.name: name
params.description: a module name

classitems.name: addAction

props.name: type
props.description:
: List of types to subscribe this action to.
The special type "__all" means that this action must be shown disregarding the type passed to the show() function.

props.name: name
props.description: (string): Unique name of this action, used for HTML classes, so no spaces or strange characters are allowed. To be safe just use camelcase letters.

props.name: label
props.description: : Label to be displayed for this menu action.

props.name: showIf(data)
props.description:
: function which decides wether or not show this
action in the menu. The data parameter passed in is the same parameter
passed when showing the menu. Usually an URI or an identifier useful
to the subscribing component to make its job.

props.name: onclick(data)
props.description:
: Function to be called when the users clicks on this action. The data parameter passed to the callback is an unique identifier of the item we are showing the menu for, or an equivalent complex structure. Usually just an identifier or an URI.
If the onclick() function returns true, the contextual menu will be hidden.

classitems.description:
Shows the contextual menu for the given type and identifier, at the given x,y coordinates.
Each component can open a contextual menu for a given type, passing in an identifier which will be used by showIf() and onclick() functions to do their job.
classitems.name: show

params.name: x
params.description: x coordinate where to show the contextual menu

params.name: y
params.description: y coordinate where to show the contextual menu

params.name: url
params.description: unique identifier to identify the clicked resource

params.name: type
params.description: type of actions to show

classitems.name: onInitDone

params.name: f()
params.description: function to be called, no parameters.

classitems.description:
Called when all of the needed modules has been 
correctly initialized. Should be used to initialize cross-component
behaviors, like subscribing to each other's callbacks.

return.description:

If multiple items have the same uri, the first items founded looping in the conteiner is returned.

classitems.name: getItemsFromParentItem

classitems.name: getItemsByType

Item are not duplicated.

Adds a triple row to the pundit area, thus adding three new

classitems.name: clearDnDTriples
classitems.description: Removes all of the pundit target rows, and adds a new empty one.

Deselects any selected item in every target of every
row currently present in TripleComposer
